alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 11:59AM EDT until April 06 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Bedford and at Shoals. White River at Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale and at Williams. White River at Edwardsport and at Petersburg. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the East Fork White River from Rivervale to Shoals....and along the White River at Edwardsport to Hazleton. Moderate flooding is occurring on the White River...at Petersburg...with brief moderate flooding possible at Hazleton Saturday. Moderate flooding is expected to end on the White River by Sunday. The East Fork White River has crested and is forecast to continue falling...while the crest on the White River will slowly pass Petersburg late today. Minor flooding is expected to end on the East Fork White River early next week...and on the White River...on Sunday at Edwardsport...while continuing at downriver points through next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, All county roads across or located in the East Fork White River flood plain flood. Flooding of agricultural land becomes extensive. The county road on northside of gage floods and gage may be inaccessible except by boat. Local residents in nearby river cabins must park on higher grounds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 25.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Friday was 27.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon and continue falling to 10.4 feet Monday, April 10. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated late this evening.
